author: Natasha Rudra
title: Editor's letter, October 11
text:
Do: Sunset yoga at Glebe Park, Civic. Photo: Supplied 
The world needs more people like Kerryn Ernst. Reading Jo Wiles cover story will bring tears to your eyes. Not just for the Canberra women whom she nurses through incurable breast cancer and cares for until the end of their lives. But for the parents, the husbands, the wives, and the children who love these women and who must somehow try to patch their hearts back together after cancer has shattered them.
I'm in awe of Kerryn's ability to have so much empathy, care and straight-up love for her patients - and I hope there are plenty of people who care for and support her in turn.
The list Do 
SUNSET YOGA 
Advertisement Join LuluLemon on the lawns of Glebe Park in Civic for a sunset yoga class, followed by a mass meditation. The idea is to "get quiet to live loud". Followed by food and drink. Wednesday, October 14, at 6.30pm. Free.
Want 
BAGS OF STYLE 
Give your travel toiletries and beauty products a nice home. These toiletry bags from designer One Busy Sloth come in a pretty range of patterns to suit your style. They're new in store at Handmade Canberra. 20 Allara Street, Civic.
Help 
THE DIARY 
This week's story about breast cancer nurse Kerryn Ernst is incredibly moving. Do your bit by getting the Australian Women's Health Diary for 2016 later this year. Sales go to the Breast Cancer Institute of Australia. $16.95. See bcia.org.au 
See 
DAY OUT 
Take the kids to the Tidbinbilla Extravaganza - including live music, indigenous activities, a reptile display, pelican feeding, and ranger guided walks. From 10am to 4pm today, Sunday, October 11, at Tidbinbilla Nature Reserve, Paddys River Road. Free entry.
